alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 10:22AM CST until March 10 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Trempealeau River at Dodge affecting Trempealeau and Buffalo Counties. For the Trempealeau River...including Arcadia, Dodge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Trempealeau River at Dodge. * WHEN...From this evening to early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Agricultural and marsh land is flooded. At 9.5 feet, The entrance road to the Trempealeau National Wildlife Refuge is flooded. At 11.0 feet, The railroad bridge about three quarters of a mile upstream from the gage can restrict the flow. At 11.5 feet, Water covers part of County Road J in Dodge. At 12.0 feet, Low lying roads around Dodge may flood, including County Road P, as well as along a low spot on County Road J south of Dodge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 10.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 07/21/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM CST.
